newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt says not buying wheat this weekend.
newsitem.headline: Egypt says not buying wheat this weekend.

text.p: The Egyptian state's wheat buyer said on Friday he did not intend to buy wheat this weekend.
"We will never buy this weekend. We have lots and lots of wheat," Samir Shakankiri, vice chairman of the state's General Authority for Supply Commodities, told Reuters.
He was responding to rumours in international wheat markets that Egypt was about to tender, possibly for 500,000 tonnes.

Shakankiri often buys large quantities of wheat through snap tenders called late on Friday evening in Cairo, just as Chicago is about to close. He picks the bids he likes before the markets reopen on Monday morning.
But Shakankiri said on Friday he was in bed and did not plan to go to his office.
